sense.name: move an object back and forth with the intent to communicate
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[animate] WAVE (NP2[concrete]) PP NP3[recipient] NOTE: There must be a recipient either stated or implied.
sense.examples: She waved to her father as the train pulled away from the station. He enthusiastically waved his greeting to the newcomers. 'This land' my father said as he waved his arm in a circle, 'Will one day be yours.' As the car drove by, I waved my arms frantically to get their attention.

sense.name: (cause to) move or swing back and forth
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[concrete] WAVE NP1[animate] WAVE NP2[concrete]
sense.examples: He waved the piece of paper. The flag waved in the breeze.

sense.name: dress someone's hair into waves
sense.examples: She asked the hairdresser to wave her hair.

sense.name: dismiss
sense.examples: She waved them off weakly from her hospital bed. He waved off suggestions of impropriety. Those in the know wave away such talk as a bluff.
